Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: கவறும் கழகமும் கையும் தருக்கி இவறியார் இல்லாகி யார்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Penniless are those who by reason of their attachment would never forsake gambling, the gambling-place and the handling (of dice).

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A gambler is shown completely enthralled by the three elements of their addiction.
Layered_Composition.Midground: In front of them are the dice ('கவறு'). They are sitting in a dark, seedy gambling den ('கழகம்'). Their hands are shown expertly and pridefully handling the dice ('கையும் தருக்கி'). Their love for these three things is all-consuming.
Layered_Composition.Background: Because of this obsessive attachment, their entire world outside the game has vanished. Their home, family, and wealth are gone, replaced by a bleak, empty void. They have become completely destitute ('இல்லாகியார்').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: Those who are pridefully attached to the dice, the gambling den, and the act of playing will inevitably lose everything and become destitute.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The focus on the three elements (dice, den, hands) as the objects of a destructive love is key. The background dissolving into an empty void shows the totality of their loss.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Addictive, obsessive, destitute, a world shrunk to nothing.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A single, sickly, low-hanging lamp illuminates the gambling table, creating a claustrophobic and obsessive atmosphere. The rest of the world is a dark, empty black.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A tight, close-up shot on the gambler's hands and the dice, with their face showing a crazed obsession. The background is a stark void.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: Psychological realism, with a symbolic background.

Cultural_Anchors: Attachment to Dice, Den, and the act of Playing
The all-consuming nature of gambling addiction.
